賀函.definition: letter of congratulations; greeting card (e.g. for New Year)

賀子珍.definition: He Zizhen (1910-1984), Mao Zedong's third wife

賀州.definition: see 賀州市|贺州市[He4zhou1 Shi4]

賀州市.definition: Hezhou, prefecture-level city in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区[Guang3xi1 Zhuang4zu2 Zi4zhi4qu1]

賀拉斯.definition: Horace, full Latin name Quintus Horatius Flaccus (65-8 BC), Roman poet

賀普丁.definition: Chinese brand name of Lamivudine 拉米夫定[La1 mi3 fu1 ding4]

賀朝.definition: He Chao (active c. 711), Tang dynasty poet

賀正.definition: to exchange compliments on New Year's Day

賀歲.definition: to extend New Year's greetings; to pay a New Year's visit

賀蘭.definition: Helan county in Yinchuan 銀川|银川[Yin2 chuan1], Ningxia

賀蘭山.definition: Helan Mountains, lying across part of the border between Ningxia and Inner Mongolia

賀蘭山岩鷚.definition: (bird species of China) Kozlov's accentor; Mongolian accentor (Prunella koslowi)

賀蘭山紅尾鴝.pinyin: He4 lan2 Shan1 hong2 wei3 qu2
賀蘭山紅尾鴝.definition: (bird species of China) Przevalski's redstart; Ala Shan redstart (Phoenicurus alaschanicus)

賀蘭山脈.definition: Helan Mountains, lying across part of the border between Ningxia and Inner Mongolia

賀蘭縣.definition: Helan county in Yinchuan 銀川|银川[Yin2 chuan1], Ningxia

賀錦麗.definition: He Jinli, Chinese name adopted by Kamala Harris (1964-), US vice president 2021-

賀龍.definition: He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
